    • Constructor Detail

      • XMLUtil

        public XMLUtil(java.lang.String url)
        throws XMLParserException
        Instantiate XMLUtil using a path to an xml document
        Parameters:
        url - full path to an xml file
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - if the input is invalid, there is an error opening the file, or there is something wrong with the xml document that doesn't allow it to be parsed.

      • XMLUtil

        public XMLUtil(org.w3c.dom.Document document)
        throws XMLParserException
        Instantiate XMLUtil using an existing DOM Handy of things like parsing DOM from a SOAP message.
        Parameters:
        document - Document object
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - if the input is invalid

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getListParametersByXpath(java.lang.String qual)
                                                          throws XMLParserException
        Returns a string list of all the matching nodes specified by the qual input parameter.
        Parameters:
        qual - String representation of an xpath query statement
        Returns:
        List<String> of values matchin the xpath
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when the xpath is invalid or there is an error processing the search

                                                            throws XMLParserException

        Parameters:
        qual - String representation of an xpath query statement
        context - Namespace context to include in the search
        Returns:
        List<String> of parameters matching the xpath
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when the inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

                                              javax.xml.namespace.NamespaceContext context)
                                       throws XMLParserException

        Parameters:
        qual - an xpath qualification string
        context - a NamespaceContext
        Returns:
        string of found value or null
        Throws:

                                                         org.w3c.dom.Node item,
                                                         javax.xml.namespace.NamespaceContext context)
                                                  throws XMLParserException
        Get a Nodelist of results of a Namespace backed xpath query of the item object
        Parameters:
        qual - an xpath query string
        item - org.w3c.dom.Node in which to search with xpath
        context - a NamespaceContext that is valid for the document
        Returns:
        org.w3c.dom.NodeList
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

        Returns:

                                                   java.lang.String fName)
                                            throws XMLParserException

        fName - a file name

        Throws:

      • getParameterByTag

        public static java.lang.String getParameterByTag(java.lang.String tag,
                                                 java.lang.String fName)
                                          throws XMLParserException
        Returns the value of the node found using the specified tag. Used for 1 and only 1 key:value pair. If more than one node exists with the same tag it will return the first node in the hierarchy
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag of the xml element node to return.
        fName - the file to parse
        Returns:
        the node value of a single element returned as a String.
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

      • getNodeListByTag

        public static org.w3c.dom.NodeList getNodeListByTag(java.lang.String tag,
                                                    java.lang.String fName)
                                             throws XMLParserException
        Returns the node(s) found using the specified tag. Used for more than 1 key:value pairs.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag of the xml element node(s) to return.
        fName - the file to parse
        Returns:
        org.w3c.dom.NodeList - elements of the node returned given the tag input or null.
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

      • getListParametersByTag

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getListParametersByTag(java.lang.String tag,
                                                                      java.lang.String fName)
                                                               throws XMLParserException
        Returns the List of String values found using the specified tag. Used for more than 1 key:value pairs.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag of the xml element node(s) to return.
        fName - the file to parse
        Returns:
        List<String>
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

      • getparametersByTagNS

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getparametersByTagNS(java.lang.String tag,
                                                             java.lang.String namespace)
                                                      throws XMLParserException
        Returns the List of String values found using the specified tag with namespace. Used for more than 1 key:value pairs.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag of the xml element node(s) to return.
        namespace - the namespace of the tag tag
        Returns:
        List<String>
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

      • getParameterByTagNS

        public java.lang.String getParameterByTagNS(java.lang.String tag,
                                            java.lang.String namespace)
        Returns the value of the node found using the specified tag and namespace. Used for 1 and only 1 key:value pair. If more than one node exists with the same tag and namespace it will return the first node in the hierarchy
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag of the xml element node to return.
        namespace - the namespace uri of the tag
        Returns:
        the node value of a single element returned as a String or null if not found.

      • getMapByTag

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getMapByTag(java.lang.String tag,
                                                                                           java.lang.String fName)
                                                                                    throws XMLParserException
        Returns a map of key value pairs found using the specified tag. Used for more than 1 key:value pairs. Provides for a unique key with multiple values per key.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag of the xml element node(s) to return.
        fName - the file to parse
        Returns:
        map - elements of the node name/value returned given the tag input.
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

      • getMapByXpath

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getMapByXpath(java.lang.String qual,
                                                                                             java.lang.String fName)
                                                                                      throws XMLParserException
        Returns a map of key value pairs found using the xpath string. Used for more than 1 key:value pairs. Provides for a unique key with multiple values per key.
        Parameters:
        qual - the tag of the xml element node(s) to return.
        fName - the file to parse
        Returns:
        map - elements of the node name/value returned given the tag input.
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the search

      • updateOrAddElement

        public void updateOrAddElement(java.lang.String xpath,
                               java.lang.String value)
                        throws XMLParserException
        Updates an existing node with a new value in the file or adds it if not already present
        Parameters:
        xpath - the name of the node to modify
        value - the value to set for the node value
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the add/update

                throws XMLParserException
        Remove a node from the existing document
        Parameters:
        xpath - an xpath statement to identify the node to remove
        Throws:
        XMLParserException - when inputs are invalid or there is an error processing the deletion
